0.user_question: Paul got a box of 601 crayons and 406 erasers for his birthday. At the end of the school year he only had 336 crayons left while not having lost a single eraser. How many more erasers than crayons did he have left?

ost_step.2: But he ended up with 336 crayons.

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. Paul lost 265 crayons so he had 601 - 265 = 336 crayons left. He didn't lose any erasers, so he still has all of them (which was 406) 406 - 336 is 70. The answer is: 70.
